ratings.comment: Not the clearest on what she expects from your writing, but really interesting to listen to in lecture and fun to discuss things with. A little overwhelming at first, but she grows on you.

We were her pioneer batch for a group research project. She communicates expectations very poorly and her lectures are completely unnecessary to completing the assignments. I'm sure half the class never did any readings whatsoever. Really felt like I learned very little from her class despite trying hard.

Nice lady, however very unclear on instructions. Even when asked for clarification, still unclear. She would often change instructions on what she wanted a week before the assignment was due. She knows what she is talking about, but doesn't know what she wants for homeworkgroup work.

A group project is basically 100% of your grade (although a small portion is attendance and participation in class). The instructions and grading criteria on this project are very unclear and vague. Feedback from Professor Hogle is even more unclear and confusing and she often changes her mind on instructions and what she expects of you.
